description: From German abseilen, from ab- (“down”) + Seil (“rope”).

entries.meaning: A descent in mountaineering using a rope looped at the top and a friction device. [First attested in the mid 20th century.]

verbs.description: abseil (third-person singular simple present abseils, present participle abseiling, simple past and past participle abseiled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To descend a steep or vertical drop using a rope with a mechanical friction device or (classic abseil) by wrapping the rope around the body; to rappel. [First attested in the mid 20th century.]
